findings.title: MAP - Misleading Admin Permission
findings.description: The contract has a variable named `owner` that is initialized to zero address, creating ambiguity regarding the ownership structure.

findings.title: CR - Code Repetition
findings.description: The contract contains repetitive code segments.

findings.title: MVN - Misleading Variables Naming
findings.description: Variables can have misleading names if their names do not accurately reflect the value they contain or the purpose they serve.

findings.title: AFI - Accumulated Fees Inconsistency
findings.description: The contract resets the accumulated fees variables without performing a distribution of the accumulated rewards.

findings.title: RSW - Redundant Storage Writes
findings.description: There are code segments that could be optimized and perform redundant storage writes.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract declares state variables that their value is initialized once in the constructor and are not modified afterwards.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The contract does not conform to Solidity naming conventions guidelines.

findings.title: L13 - Divide before Multiply Operation
findings.description: Performing divisions before multiplications may cause loss of precision.

findings.title: L18 - Multiple Pragma Directives
findings.description: If the contract includes multiple conflicting pragma directives, it may produce unexpected errors.

findings.title: L19 - Stable Compiler Version
findings.description: The `^` symbol indicates that any version of Solidity that is compatible with the specified version can be used to compile the contract.

findings.title: L20 - Succeeded Transfer Check
findings.description: According to the ERC20 specification, the transfer methods should be checked if the result is successful.

findings.title: Misrepresentation of Contract Renouncement
findings.description: The contract is falsely represented as being renounced, but it has not undergone the renouncement process.
